intro: Cyclobalanopsis championii, commonly known as the Champion's evergreen oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. It is a large evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India, characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and robust trunk. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by hard, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It plays a vital role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
